result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael B Daniels was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: Repeater], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).
  • Misappropriate ID Info - Obtain Money [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.201(2)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Ct 1 is Concurrent to Ozaukee Co Case 10-CF-294.  Creidt for 192 served on Ct 1.

superMiscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.
++  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges - DNA - not ordered.  May Not have contact with Elisabeth K, Shelly M or Scamps Gymnastics.  Remain within Milwakuee Co.

records.addlTxt: Motion for sentence credit filed by the Defendant is Denied for reasons placed on the record.

Attorney Jennifer Phan appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared by phone from Redgranite Correctional.  The court denies the DE's motion for additional credit.  Judgment to be amended to strike must remain in Milwaukee County.  Clerk D. Smith.

Attorney Jennifer Phan appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in custody, by phone.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Issue of sentence credit.  Court amends judgment to indicate that ct 1 is concurrent to Ozaukee County case 10CF294 and that deft has credit for 192 days served on ct 1.

Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge

Attorney Jennifer Phan appeared for the State.  Def. appeared (in custody) with Atty Jerold Breitenbach.  Clerk K. Zirbel.  Sentencing arguments heard.
Count 1 - Total sentence:  5 years.
Initial term of confinement:  2 years WSP, credit for 192 days served.
Length of extended supervision:  3 years w/conditions.
Count 2 - Total sentence:  3 years.
Initial term of confinement:  1 year WSP.
Length of extended supervision:  2 years w/conditions.
Sentence in Count 2 is consecutive to Count 1.
Def. is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program but not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
Firearms warning given to defendant.  DNA sample not ordered; previously submitted.
From DA regarding additional Discovery

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Tracey Braun appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody w/Atty Jerry Breitenbach.  Case is resolved.  Victim rights compliance.  Deft pleads guilty to counts 1 & 2; found guilty by the Court.  Admits to repeater on both counts.  Count 3 is dismissed & read-in on State's motion.  PSI ordered.  Sentencing set for 8/25/16 @ 9am.

Judge Barbara A. Kluka, Acting Br. 6 today only.  Attorney Jennifer Phan appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney J Breitenbach.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  State in victim compliance.  Atty Breitenbach states he would like to attempt to negotiate a global agreement w/deft's Milwaukee, Fond du Lac and Racine cases.  FPT continued to 7/15/16 at 8:30am.  Bond continued.
2/25/16 - Preliminary Hearing
No disposition. Leave on for next scheduled court activity.

Defendant Michael B Daniels appeared with Attorney Jerold William Breitenbach.  Defendant in custody. Attorney Jennifer A. Phan appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk JThwing. Probable cause found; bound over for trial to Br 6. Information filed; reading waived. Not guilty pleas entered. Bond continued. DA Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 18, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
